t: To the choirmaster: for the flutes. A Psalm of David.
Give*pn ear to my words, O Lord;*s consider*ld my groaning.
Give*ln attention to the sound of my cry, my*ld King and my God, for*ld to you do I pray.
O*ln Lord,*s in the morning you hear my voice; in*ld the morning I prepare a sacrifice for you and watch.
For*pn you are not a God who delights in wickedness; evil*ld may not dwell with you.
The*ln boastful shall not stand before your eyes; you*ld hate all evildoers.
You*ln destroy those who speak lies; the*ld Lord*s abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
But*pn I, through the abundance of your steadfast love, will*ld enter your house. I*ln will bow down toward your holy temple in*ld the fear of you.
Lead*ln me, O Lord,*s in your righteousness because*ld of my enemies; make*ld your way straight before me.
For*pn there is no truth in their mouth; their*ld inmost self is destruction; their*ln throat is an open grave; they*ld flatter with their tongue.
Make*ln them bear their guilt, O God; let*ld them fall by their own counsels; because*ln of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out, for*ld they have rebelled against you.
But*pn let all who take refuge in you rejoice; let*ld them ever sing for joy, and*ln spread your protection over them, that*ld those who love your name may exult in you.
For*ln you bless the righteous, O Lord;*s you*ld cover him with favor as with a shield.
